stories.text:
I've been a software engineer for a long time but I've taken time off to retrain in product development and UX design, with the intention of working in a combined role.

Self-learning has been going well, I'm halfway through the Google UX course and I've been doing a lot of exercises and putting together a portfolio.

But when I was young I worked tech support and I got to thinking how seeing the pain points on the product support side would help immensely to understand how design decisions impact the end user.

Would it be insane to take a product support role for 6 months to a year while I work on my UX portfolio, side projects and self-education?

I'll take a haircut on salary, but money's not an issue right now due to a combination of a low COL and savings.

If you hire and saw someone shifted gears this way, would that be a plus or a minus in your decision?
stories.title: Ask HN: Working as a product support technician to help learn UX/product design?
